Section.Content: This memo is under public-domain. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.

Section.Name: Abstract
Section.Content: The GoldFish Broadcast Protocol (GFBP) is an application-level protocol to allow clients to broadcast themselves to other clients, to find other multiplayer connection with player names.

Section.Name: Purpose
Section.Content: The GoldFish Broadcast Protocol (GFBP) is an application-level protocol to allow clients to broadcast themselves to other clients, to find other multiplayer connection with player names. This specification describes the featues that are RECOMMENDED be implemented for GFBP clients and servers.

Section.Name: Terminology
Section.Content: This specification uses a number of terms to refer to the roles played by participants in, and objects of, the GFBP communciation.

IndentSection.Content: The basic unit of GFBP communication, consisting of a structured frame matching the definition in Section 3 and transmitted via the connection.

Section.Name: Conformance Requirements
Section.Content: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.
